Beginning_Balance_Journal_Entry_Line_Dat.description: Alternate Ledger Account (ALA) provides the ability, when Alternate Account Set is enabled for the header company,  to override the account to which the Ledger Account is mapped by the Alternate Account Set Mapping rules.I.E. - if the Ledger Account is 1000 Cash, and the mapping rules map the journal to the 1100 Alternate Cash account, setting the ALA to 1200: Other Cash Account will cause the journal to use Other Cash rather than Alternate Cash.

validation.validation: The given ledger account has restrictions that do not allow it to be used by this company.
At least one of the Ledger Accounts entered is retired. Only non retired accounts are allowed.
Alternate Ledger Account: [ala] is not a member of [company]'s Primary or Alternate Account Sets.

Beginning_Balance_Journal_Entry_Line_Dat.description: Reference to the transaction currency of the journal line. You can provide a company or foreign currency.

validation.validation: Currency Conversion Rates between currency and company's default currency are not defined.
validation.description: Currency Conversion Rates between the currency on the Journal Line and company's default currency must be defined for the selected Currency Rate Type, effective as of the Accounting Date for the Journal. This validation only applies to Accounting Journals.

validation.validation: The Currency Rate cannot be negative.
If the base currency is equal to the transaction currency, the currency rate cannot be entered.
If the base currency and the transaction currency are equal, the transaction amount must equal the ledger amount.
validation.description: If the base currency and the transaction currency are equal, the transaction amount must equal the ledger amount.

validation.validation: Decimal precision of [precision] for [currency] exceeded for Debit Amount: [amount]
validation.description: The Debit Amount precision cannot exceed the precision of the Company currency.

validation.validation: Decimal precision of [precision] for [currency] exceeded for Credit Amount: [amount]
validation.description: The Credit Amount precision cannot exceed the precision of the Company currency.

validation.validation: If the base currency and the transaction currency are equal, the transaction amount must equal the ledger amount.
validation.description: If the base currency and the transaction currency are equal, the transaction amount must equal the ledger amount.

Beginning_Balance_Journal_Entry_Line_Dat.description: Reference to existing worktags. Worktags are a way to mark tasks and business objects to make them easier to access and summarize.  Each transaction can include one value for each worktag type and is subject to configurable validation when submitted for approval.

validation.validation: [invalid worktag value message]
The [type] is/are not available for use with the company/s: [partitionable] [company]
Only one worktag of each type is allowed
validation.description: Only one worktag of each type is allowed

validation.validation: The following worktag type and value pairs are invalid because the worktag is inactive: [worktag and type].
Select a balancing worktag for Worktags of the following type: [type]
validation.description: A balancing worktag is required if worktag balancing has been enabled for the tenant.

validation.validation: Enter an Interworktag Affiliate that is the type [tenant type].
validation.description: The Interworktag Affiliate Type must be of the same type as defined for Balancing Worktags at the tenant level.

validation.validation: The Balancing Worktag in the Worktags field is not allowed to be the same as the Interworktag Affiliate.
You must have Worktag Balancing enabled in order to define a Worktag Balancing Affiliate.
validation.description: You must have Worktag Balancing enabled in order to define a Worktag Balancing Affiliate.

Beginning_Balance_Journal_Entry_Line_Dat.description: For expense report and supplier invoice transactions tied to a capital project worktag, Workday creates special accounting to appropriately debit the Work in Progress account, while also recording the amount as a debit into the Spend account.  This is necessary to reflect correct amounts for the purposes of Budget Checking/Reporting, and any other custom spend reports.
The number Workday automatically assigned to the journal line.

Beginning_Balance_Journal__HV__Data.description: Element containing all Journal Entry Line data

validation.validation: Cannot have an Employee Worktag along with a Contingent Worker Worktag for the same line.
Can not have any combination of Project, Project Phase or Project Task worktags for the same line.
validation.description: Can not have any combination of Project, Project Phase or Project Task worktags for the same line.

validation.validation: Only one worktag for each type is allowed for each document line.
validation.description: Only one worktag for each type is allowed for each document line.

validation.validation: Enter Unit of Measure 2 for Quantity 2.
The following worktag type(s) are required: [missing]
Enter Quantity 2 for Unit of Measure 2.
The Ledger Accounts for each Journal Line must be of a Balance Sheet Type.
validation.description: The Ledger Accounts for each Journal Line must be of a Balance Sheet Type.

validation.validation: You are attempting to submit a journal for [company] which does not have a resulting ledger account mapped or specified.
Enter the Unit of Measure for the Quantity.
Enter the Quantity for the Unit of Measure.
The Credit and Debit Amounts are both zero.
validation.description: The Credit and Debit Amounts are both zero.

validation.validation: The Credit and Debit Amount both have values.
validation.description: The Credit and Debit Amount both have values.
